sentences: Ma ei tea, mida ta tahab rääkida.
context: The verb 'rääkida' means to talk or speak in Estonian. It's the da-infinitive form of the verb 'rääkima'. The word is commonly used when referring to having conversations or speaking about topics, people, or subjects. In example sentences, it can be conjugated as 'räägib' (he/she talks), 'rääkida' (to talk), and 'räägid' (you speak).
